definitions.text: the temporal end; the concluding time
examples: the stopping point of each round was signaled by a bell
the market was up at the finish
they were playing better at the close of the season

definitions.text: the last section of a communication
examples: in conclusion I want to say...

definitions.text: the concluding part of any performance
move so that an opening or passage is obstructed; make shut
become closed
examples: The windows closed with a loud bang

definitions.text: cease to operate or cause to cease operating
examples: The owners decided to move and to close the factory
My business closes every night at 8 P.M.

definitions.text: finish or terminate (meetings, speeches, etc.)
examples: The meeting was closed with a charge by the chairman of the board

definitions.text: come to a close
examples: The concert closed with a nocturne by Chopin

definitions.text: complete a business deal, negotiation, or an agreement
examples: We closed on the house on Friday
They closed the deal on the building

definitions.text: be priced or listed when trading stops
examples: The stock market closed high this Friday
My new stocks closed at $59 last night

definitions.text: engage at close quarters
cause a window or an application to disappear on a computer desktop
change one's body stance so that the forward shoulder and foot are closer to the intended point of impact
come together, as if in an embrace
examples: Her arms closed around her long lost relative

definitions.text: draw near
examples: The probe closed with the space station

definitions.text: bring together all the elements or parts of
bar access to
examples: Due to the accident, the road had to be closed for several hours

definitions.text: fill or stop up
examples: Can you close the cracks with caulking?

definitions.text: unite or bring into contact or bring together the edges of
finish a game in baseball by protecting a lead
examples: The relief pitcher closed with two runs in the second inning

definitions.text: at or within a short distance in space or time or having elements near each other
examples: how close are we to town?

definitions.text: close in relevance or relationship
examples: we are all...in close sympathy with...

definitions.text: not far distant in time or space or degree or circumstances
examples: a near hit by the bomb

definitions.text: rigorously attentive; strict and thorough
examples: kept a close watch on expenditures

definitions.text: marked by fidelity to an original
examples: a faithful copy of the portrait
a faithful rendering of the observed facts

definitions.text: (of a contest or contestants) evenly matched
crowded
lacking fresh air
examples: hot and stuffy and the air was blue with smoke

definitions.text: of textiles
examples: smooth percale with a very tight weave

definitions.text: strictly confined or guarded
confined to specific persons
fitting closely but comfortably
used of hair or haircuts
giving or spending with reluctance
examples: very close (or near) with his money

definitions.text: inclined to secrecy or reticence about divulging information
examples: although they knew her whereabouts her friends kept close about it

definitions.text: near in time or place or relationship
examples: as the wedding day drew near
don't shoot until they come near
getting near to the true explanation
don't get too close to the fire

definitions.text: in an attentive manner
examples: he remained close on his guard
